sub_title: PhD Environmental Toxicology- e-Waste Management | Recycling | Risk Assessment | Public Health | Sustainability
summary:
I am driven by the need to see sustainable development even at the grass-root level, to see sustainability mindset and approach integrated into every aspect of a business. How can research findings drive policy formulation and implementation; Knowledge into action? I contribute to making the environment beautiful as I enjoy hiking in nature and cleaning. I look at the nexus between the environment, social/economic wealth, and health. I am most attracted to the exceptional opportunity of improving people's lives. 

I am really interested in bridging the gap between decision-makers (formal sectors) and the workers in the private and informal settings (informal associations) using scientific evidence to ensure sustainable development without jeopardizing the people’s livelihood. 

My dream is to see regulations and policies effectively enforced in developing countries without impeding the people’s livelihood. 

HOW CAN I HELP

As a Public health specialist/researcher of over 12 years of professional experience with various NGOs. I constantly work to improve the overall health of communities, making the world a safer and healthier place. I conduct research on various areas of public health. How do the activities in the environment affect our food and health?

I conduct research through:

•Project management -Research Planning, Designing, Implementation, and M&E

•Analyses of research data 

•Research on environmental hazards or concerns that may potentially place a population at risk

•Carry out Health Risk Assessment and Risk Communication
•Project Management, from design to implementation

•Develop new research methods/procedures in order to improve various methods of public health 
         research

•Implement new methods and new public health projects/programmes

•Research on health trends within a population

•Find root causes for different public health hazards or risks that may negatively affect a population

•Research on solutions to issues of public health importance

You can also contact me via 
email: chimeremayq@yahoo.co.uk  
Mobile: +31 684 668 129

treasury_media.title: Prevalence and injury patterns among electronic waste workers in the informal sector in Nigeria
treasury_media.description: Background Despite the large volume of e-waste recycled informally, the prevalence of work-related injuries among e-waste workers is unknown. Therefore, this study assessed the prevalence, patterns and factors associated with occupational injuries...

treasury_media.title: Hydrophobic Organic Pollutants in Soils and Dusts at Electronic Waste Recycling Sites: Occurrence and Possible Impacts of Polybrominated Diphenyl Ethers
treasury_media.description: Concerns about the adverse consequences of informal electronic waste (e-waste) recycling is increasing, because e-waste contains some hazardous substances such as polybrominated diphenyl ethers (PBDEs) which is used as flame retardants in electronics....

treasury_media.title: Health Risks of Polybrominated Diphenyl Ethers (PBDEs) and Metals at Informal Electronic Waste Recycling Sites
treasury_media.description: Concerns about the adverse public health consequences of informal electronic waste (e-waste) recycling are increasing. This study adopted a cross-sectional study design to gain insights into health risks (cancer and non-cancer risks) associated with...

treasury_media.title: Health Risks Awareness of Electronic Waste Workers in the Informal Sector in Nigeria
treasury_media.description: Insight into the health risk awareness levels of e-waste workers is important as it may offer opportunities for better e-waste recycling management strategies to reduce the health effects of informal e-waste recycling. Therefore, this study assessed...

profile_positions.title: Occupational Safety Health Specialist

profile_positions.description:
C-Circle Research offers consultancy services and researches on how our environment affects our health with a focus on embedding sustainability approaches in public health services. 
We specialized in carrying out public health researches, health education and promotion campaigns, training, and also help businesses embed sustainability approaches into their daily operations. Our motto is ‘Raising Environmental Consciousness’. We work in all the states in Nigeria. 


C-Circle is a young organization; the website is still under construction.

profile_positions.description:
GAIN is one of the world’s foremost international Not-for-Profit organizations (NGO)
 in the fight against malnutrition. 
www.gainhealth.org/


•Contributed to improving the capacity of about 300 regulatory officials and industry Quality Control officers to carry out monitoring of Universal Salt Iodization (USI) at factory and market levels which has contributed to ensuring that 100% of all salt factories are complying with the Universal Salt Iodization
•Contributed to the development of a national plan for USI in Nigeria
profile_positions.title: Nutrition Consultant-Monitoring & Evaluation

company.name: Global Alliance for Improved Nutrition (GAIN) www.gainhealth.org/

profile_positions.company: Global Alliance for Improved Nutrition (GAIN) www.gainhealth.org/
profile_positions.description:
•Provided technical advice, supervision, coordination, Monitoring, evaluation, and organizational 
  support to Benue State Ministry of Health (SMOH) to pilot the first large-scale Implementation of 
  Multiple Micro-nutrient powder (MNP) in Nigeria
•Provided oversight on the logistics needed to deliver adequate quantity of MNP to the selected 
  health facilities in all the wards in the targeted 5 local government areas (LGAs)
•The project reached 280,000 children aged 6-59 months with 30 sachets of MNP every 6 months 
  between December 2013 and December 2014 through Maternal, Newborn and Child Health week 
  (MNCHW) and Immunization Plus Days (IPDs)
•Coordinated delivery of MNP and other health interventions to internally displaced persons (IDP)
  camps
•Contributed to influencing government to adopt MNCHW as one of the veritable service delivery      platforms
•	Developed proposals for funding of other nutrition and health-related projects in Nigeria
profile_positions.title: Nutrition Consultant – Field Project Coordinator/Micro-Nutrient Specialist

company.name: Partnership for Transforming Health Systems II (PATHS 2)

profile_positions.company: Partnership for Transforming Health Systems II (PATHS 2)
profile_positions.description:
PATHS 2 was a DIFID supported project on improving the planning, financing, and delivery of sustainable, replicable, pro-poor health services for common health problems. It particularly focused on improving child health and reducing maternal mortality in Nigeria.
www.abtassociates.com/projects/the-partnership-for-transforming-health-systems-2-paths2


•Contributed to the development of 4 data collection tools which are used at various levels:- Health 
  facility level, Local government level, State level, and the National level.
•Populated the database of BCC unit of PATHS2, Nigeria
•Contributed to implementing community–based BCC in 203 health facilities in 5 states in Nigeria:- 
  Enugu, Jigawa, Kaduna, Kano, and Lagos
•Contributed to a 52% increase in the number of Antenatal Care (ANC) visit in PATHS 2 states
•26% of women reported learning danger signs from PATHS 2 broadcasts
profile_positions.title: Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E)/Data Analyst for Behavioural Change Communication (BCC) unit

profile_positions.company: Partnership for Transforming Health Systems II (PATHS 2)
profile_positions.description:
www.abtassociates.com/projects/the-partnership-for-transforming-health-systems-2-paths2

•Contributed to the development of 4 data collection tools in health facilities 
•Contributed to evidence on improving all the nine health facility registers (general attendance 
   register, in-patient register, immunization register, ANC register, delivery-room register,) which is 
    currently used nationally
•Increase in the completeness of data from 25% in 2012 to 100% in 2014 mostly in rural areas
profile_positions.title: Team Coordinator/Data Analyst- Local Technical Assistant on Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E)

profile_positions.description:
•Contributed to the large-scale fortification of flour, sugar and vegetable oil with Vitamin A
•Contributed to the national survey on compliance of Vitamin A fortification of foods at factory and 
 market levels 
•Developed the database for Vitamin A fortified food samples at factory and market levels 
•Contributed to the revision of Vitamins A fortification standards in line with WHO guidelines 
•Contributed to the training of approximately 300 regulatory officials and industry Quality Control Officers, this has resulted in increased compliance level of Vitamin A fortification of national selected foods (flour, sugar, and vegetable oil). 100 million people are now reached with Vitamin A fortified foods
